docs.snippet: To the Editor of the New-York Times : In Tuesday's TIMES appeared an article under the heading, "The Health of the City." Permit me to make extracts from that article, with brief comments. You say that "The health of the City never was better than it...
docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor of the New-York Times : In Tuesday's TIMES appeared an article under the heading, "The Health of the City." Permit me to make extracts from that article, with brief comments. You say that "The health of the City never was better than it is now."

docs.snippet: THE REASON WHY.-At a meeting of the Board of Health, last week, a complaint was made against the offal contractor, who it was allege I permitted an unreasonable number of dead animals to accumulate at the wharf, foot of Cliaton-avenue, the place of...
docs.lead_paragraph: THE REASON WHY.-At a meeting of the Board of Health, last week, a complaint was made against the offal contractor, who it was allege I permitted an unreasonable number of dead animals to accumulate at the wharf, foot of Cliaton-avenue, the place of shipment. At a meeting of the Board yesterday, the Contractor appeared in person to answer the complaint. He denied that there was any reasonable ground for the complaint that had been made,

docs.snippet: Among the distinguished arrivals by one of the recent steamers from Europe, is Madame OMAR Pacha, wife of the celebrated Turkish commander who won so many laurels in Silistria. We understand that she has come to reside in this country, at least for...
docs.lead_paragraph: Among the distinguished arrivals by one of the recent steamers from Europe, is Madame OMAR Pacha, wife of the celebrated Turkish commander who won so many laurels in Silistria. We understand that she has come to reside in this country, at least for the present. Her history is somewhat remarkable, She is a native of Transylvania, and at 11 years of age was sent to school at Bucharest, where she developed

docs.snippet: Messrs. ISAAC PECK, WILLIAM ROE, and ALLEN MACDONALD, Delegates from St. George's Church, Flushing, to the late Diocesan Convention, have published a vigorous remonstrance against the restoration of Bishop ONDERDONE. It is understood that the lady,...

headline.main: THE CASE OF BISHOP ONDERDONK.; Report of the Flushing Delegates-Remonstrance against Restoration.

docs.lead_paragraph: Messrs. ISAAC PECK, WILLIAM ROE, and ALLEN MACDONALD, Delegates from St. George's Church, Flushing, to the late Diocesan Convention, have published a vigorous remonstrance against the restoration of Bishop ONDERDONE. It is understood that the lady, to whom reference is made in this document, is Mrs. BEARE, the deceased wife of an Episcopal clergyman at Flushing, who was one of the witnesses against Bishop ONDEBDONK at his trial. The Delegates say:

docs.snippet: We steamship Indian, from Liverpool at 11 o'clock on the morning of the 28th ult., passed this point at 3 1/2 o'clock this afternoon, and will reach Quebec about 5 o'clock to-morrow morning. Her dates are four days later than those already received.

headline.main: LATER EUROPEAN NEWS.; ARRIVAL OF THE INDIAN. Further Delay in Dispatching the Great Eastern. A Congress for the Italian Question. The American Minister Imprisoned in Peking. IMPORTANT FROM JAPAN.

docs.lead_paragraph: We steamship Indian, from Liverpool at 11 o'clock on the morning of the 28th ult., passed this point at 3 1/2 o'clock this afternoon, and will reach Quebec about 5 o'clock to-morrow morning. Her dates are four days later than those already received.

docs.snippet: The cricket match at Hoboken and the interest it has excited, seems to have led some people to the conclusion that a new era is about to be inaugurated, that every doctor, lawyer, editor and merchant in the country will henceforward devote himself to...
docs.lead_paragraph: The cricket match at Hoboken and the interest it has excited, seems to have led some people to the conclusion that a new era is about to be inaugurated, that every doctor, lawyer, editor and merchant in the country will henceforward devote himself to the bat and ball, and present himself to the admiring gaze of his friends with a pair of rosy cheeks and a stomach of leather ;

docs.snippet: BOARD OF ALDERMEN. Quarterly Report of the street Commis sioner-The City Inspector and the Pavements--An Exhausted Appropriation. The Quarterly Report of the Street Commissioner was transmitted to the Board of Aldermen last evening. The following is...
docs.lead_paragraph: BOARD OF ALDERMEN. Quarterly Report of the street Commis sioner-The City Inspector and the Pavements--An Exhausted Appropriation. The Quarterly Report of the Street Commissioner was transmitted to the Board of Aldermen last evening. The following is a statement of the amount of requisitions drawn upon the Comptroller by the Street Commissioner, and the amount upon each appropriation and account for the quarter ending Sept.

docs.snippet: The mails by the Canada, whose arrival at Boston has been announced, reached this City at a late hour on Saturday night. Our London files furnish most interesting particulars of Capt. MCCLINTOCK'S successful explorations in the steam-yacht Fox.

headline.main: NEWS FROM EUROPE.; The San Juan Quarrel. THE GREAT EASTERN. ARRIVAL OF THE CANADA'S MAILS. The Search for Sir John Franklin.

docs.lead_paragraph: The mails by the Canada, whose arrival at Boston has been announced, reached this City at a late hour on Saturday night. Our London files furnish most interesting particulars of Capt. MCCLINTOCK'S successful explorations in the steam-yacht Fox.

docs.snippet: MUSIC IN THE CENTRAL PARK.-The melancholy days have come, the saddest, if not the shortest, of the year; and their depressing influence has made itself felt in the delightful ramble of the Central Park. Mr. OLMSTED, too, the very "pulse of the...
docs.lead_paragraph: MUSIC IN THE CENTRAL PARK.-The melancholy days have come, the saddest, if not the shortest, of the year; and their depressing influence has made itself felt in the delightful ramble of the Central Park. Mr. OLMSTED, too, the very "pulse of the machine," has gone to Europe, partly for his health, partly to do the City service in his arduous pursuit of the true standard of excellence in Parks.
